name: yakitori
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a Japanese dish consisting of pieces of chicken that are put on a long, thin, metal or wooden pin to hold them together, and cooked over fire or hot coals: Eating yakitori from street sellers is one of my favourite things to do. They like to relax at the end of the day by having a drink and eating yakitori.
More examplesFewer examplesThere are loads of cheap yakitori restaurants in that part of town.The secret to delicious yakitori is getting the sweet sauce that goes with the grilled chicken right.They provided a selection of sushi, sashimi, and yakitori for the party.
